You can use a predefined set of rules or add your own by specifying valid ruleset.xml files. See the rules index (phpmd.org) and How to create a custom rule set (phpmd.org) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports coding style problems detected by PHP Mess Detector.


The inspection requires PHP Mess Detector to be properly installed and set up in the IDE under
[Settings \| PHP \| Quality Tools \| Mess Detector](settings://settings.php.quality.tools.mess.detector).


To learn more about installing PHP Mess Detector, see [PHP Mess Detector installation (phpmd.org)](https://phpmd.org/download/index.html) for details.


You can use a predefined set of rules or add your own by specifying valid *ruleset.xml* files. See the [rules index (phpmd.org)](https://phpmd.org/rules/index.html) and [How to create a custom rule set (phpmd.org)](https://phpmd.org/documentation/creating-a-ruleset.html) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports deprecated cast expressions: '(unset)' cast expressions, which are deprecated in PHP 7.2 and later. '(real)' cast expressions, which are deprecated in PHP 7.4 and later. See Deprecated features in PHP 7.2.x (php.net) and Deprecations for PHP 7.4 (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports deprecated cast expressions:

* `(unset)` cast expressions, which are deprecated in PHP 7.2 and later.
* `(real)` cast expressions, which are deprecated in PHP 7.4 and later.


See [Deprecated features in PHP 7.2.x (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/migration72.deprecated.php#migration72.deprecated.unset-cast) and [Deprecations for PHP 7.4 (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/deprecations_php_7_4#the_real_type) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports deprecated usages of the 'assertEquals' and 'assertNotEquals' functions with '$delta', '$maxDepth', '$canonicalize', and '$ignoreCase' parameters. The optional '$delta', '$maxDepth', '$canonicalize', and '$ignoreCase' parameters of the 'assertEquals' and 'assertNotEquals' functions are deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9. See Usage of the assertEquals function (phpunit.readthedocs.io) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports deprecated usages of the `assertEquals` and `assertNotEquals` functions with `$delta`, `$maxDepth`, `$canonicalize`, and `$ignoreCase` parameters.

The optional `$delta`, `$maxDepth`, `$canonicalize`, and `$ignoreCase` parameters
of the `assertEquals` and `assertNotEquals` functions are deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9.


See [Usage of the assertEquals function (phpunit.readthedocs.io)](https://phpunit.readthedocs.io/en/stable/assertions.html#assertequals) for details.

shortDescription.text: Nested 'dirname()' call can be replaced with 'levels' parameter usage

fullDescription.text: Reports the nested 'dirname()' calls that can be omitted by using the 'levels' parameter instead.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the nested `dirname()` calls that can be omitted by using the `levels` parameter instead.

shortDescription.text: PHPUnit annotation is deprecated in PHPUnit 11 and can be replaced with attribute

fullDescription.text: Suggests replacing PHPUnit annotations with attributes.
fullDescription.markdown: Suggests replacing PHPUnit annotations with attributes.

fullDescription.text: Reports the write expressions on properties which are immediately overwritten before being accessed.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the write expressions on properties which are immediately overwritten before being accessed.

fullDescription.text: Reports potentially ambiguous expressions and proposes enclosing them in clarifying parentheses.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports potentially ambiguous expressions and proposes enclosing them in clarifying parentheses.

fullDescription.text: Reports empty arguments lists in attributes. See Attributes (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports empty arguments lists in attributes.


See [Attributes (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/attributes_v2) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the methods' parameters whose names differ from the same parameters defined in parent methods. Starting with PHP 8.0, such code can cause runtime errors.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the methods' parameters whose names differ from the same parameters defined in parent methods. Starting with PHP 8.0, such code can cause runtime errors.

fullDescription.text: Reports the cases of several traits being imported via a single 'use' statement. According to PSR-12, each individual trait imported into a class MUST be included one-per-line, and each inclusion MUST have its own 'use' import statement. See PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the cases of several traits being imported via a single `use` statement.


According to PSR-12, each individual trait imported into a class MUST be included one-per-line, and each inclusion MUST have its own `use` import statement.


See [PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org)](https://www.php-fig.org/psr/psr-12/#42-using-traits) for details.

shortDescription.text: Concatenation to empty string can be merged with assignment

fullDescription.text: Reports the '.=' concatenation assignments performed right after assignment to an empty string literal. Such assignments can be merged together.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `.=` concatenation assignments performed right after assignment to an empty string literal. Such assignments can be merged together.

fullDescription.text: Highlights the quality tools' entries in composer.json in case the corresponding code inspections are disabled.
fullDescription.markdown: Highlights the quality tools' entries in *composer.json* in case the corresponding code inspections are disabled.

fullDescription.text: Reports the fields with default initializers that are always overwritten in the class constructor.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the fields with default initializers that are always overwritten in the class constructor.

shortDescription.text: Array internal pointer reset is unnecessary

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'reset($array)' calls on arrays whose internal pointer is already set on the first element. Such calls are redundant and can be safely removed. See reset (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the `reset($array)` calls on arrays whose internal pointer is already set on the first element. Such calls are redundant and can be safely removed.


See [reset (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.reset.php) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports arguments with name identifiers.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports arguments with name identifiers.

shortDescription.text: Empty index operator not supported for strings

fullDescription.text: Reports the usages of empty index operator ('[]') on strings. Starting from PHP 7.1, applying the empty index operator on a string throws a fatal error. See Creating/modifying with square bracket syntax (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the usages of empty index operator (`[]`) on strings.


Starting from PHP 7.1, applying the empty index operator on a string throws a fatal error.

See [Creating/modifying with square bracket syntax (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/language.types.array.php#language.types.array.syntax.modifying) for details.

shortDescription.text: Trait use rule resolved to method with different containing class

fullDescription.text: Reports the trait method 'use' rules that are resolved to methods from a different containing class rather than the one specified in the 'use' declaration.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the trait method `use` rules that are resolved to methods from a different containing class rather than the one specified in the `use` declaration.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'assertTrue()' and 'assertNotTrue()' methods calls that are provided with an 'array_key_exists()' call as an argument. Such calls can be replaced with calls to the dedicated 'assertArrayHasKey()' method. See assertArrayHasKey (phpunit.readthedocs.io) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the `assertTrue()` and `assertNotTrue()` methods calls that are provided with an `array_key_exists()` call as an argument. Such calls can be replaced with calls to the dedicated `assertArrayHasKey()` method.


See [assertArrayHasKey (phpunit.readthedocs.io)](https://phpunit.readthedocs.io/en/stable/assertions.html#assertarrayhaskey) for details.

shortDescription.text: Local object is used only for writing properties

fullDescription.text: Reports the variable assignments to new objects that are used only for writing the object's properties without observable side effects.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the variable assignments to new objects that are used only for writing the object's properties without observable side effects.

fullDescription.text: Reports 'static' usages inside final class
fullDescription.markdown: Reports `static` usages inside final class

fullDescription.text: Reports the references to dynamic class properties declarations. Such declaration are deprecated starting from PHP 8.2 The inspection skips the objects of the 'stdClass' or derived types.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the references to dynamic class properties declarations. Such declaration are deprecated starting from PHP 8.2


The inspection skips the objects of the `stdClass` or derived types.

fullDescription.text: Reports the parameters' names and types in a PHPDoc comment that do not match the ones in the function/method declaration.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the parameters' names and types in a PHPDoc comment that do not match the ones in the function/method declaration.

shortDescription.text: Multiple classes declarations in one file

fullDescription.text: Reports multiple class declarations in a single file, which violates the PSR-0/PSR-4 standards. See PSR-0/PSR-4 standards (php-fig.org) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports multiple class declarations in a single file, which violates the PSR-0/PSR-4 standards.


See [PSR-0/PSR-4 standards (php-fig.org)](https://www.php-fig.org/psr/psr-4/) for details.

shortDescription.text: Array write access is not used

fullDescription.text: Reports the array write access expressions that are not used in code afterwards. The most common source of such problems is modifying an array passed via a parameter: if an array is passed by value, the change will not be visible outside the function.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the array write access expressions that are not used in code afterwards. The most common source of such problems is modifying an array passed via a parameter: if an array is passed by value, the change will not be visible outside the function.

shortDescription.text: Class cannot be used as attribute

fullDescription.text: Reports the attributes that are resolved to a class not annotated with '#[Attribute]'. See Attributes (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the attributes that are resolved to a class not annotated with `#[Attribute]`.


See [Attributes (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/attributes_v2) for details.

shortDescription.text: Method's return value is never used

fullDescription.text: Reports the private methods returning the values that are not used.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the private methods returning the values that are not used.

fullDescription.text: Reports the deprecated usages of the 'assertFileEquals', 'assertFileNotEquals', 'assertStringEqualsFile', and 'assertStringNotEqualsFile' functions with the '$canonicalize' and '$ignoreCase' parameters. The optional '$canonicalize' and '$ignoreCase' parameters of the 'assertFileEquals' and 'assertFileNotEquals' functions are deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9. See Usage of the assertFileEquals function (phpunit.readthedocs.io) or Usage of the assertFileEquals function (phpunit.readthedocs.io) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the deprecated usages of the `assertFileEquals`, `assertFileNotEquals`, `assertStringEqualsFile`, and `assertStringNotEqualsFile` functions with the `$canonicalize` and `$ignoreCase` parameters.

The optional `$canonicalize` and `$ignoreCase` parameters
of the `assertFileEquals` and `assertFileNotEquals` functions are deprecated and will be removed in PHPUnit 9.


See [Usage of the assertFileEquals function (phpunit.readthedocs.io)](https://phpunit.readthedocs.io/en/stable/assertions.html#assertfileequals) or [Usage of the assertFileEquals function (phpunit.readthedocs.io)](https://phpunit.readthedocs.io/en/stable/assertions.html#assertstringequalsfile) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the usages of variable variables (dynamic variable names such as '$$a').
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the usages of variable variables (dynamic variable names such as `$$a`).

fullDescription.text: Reports the usages of deprecated 'Serializable' interface. Starting from PHP 8.1, classes that are non-abstract, implement 'Serializable', and do not implement '__serialize()' and '__unserialize()' will throw a deprecation warning. See Phasing out Serializable (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the usages of deprecated `Serializable` interface.


Starting from PHP 8.1, classes that are non-abstract, implement `Serializable`, and do not implement `__serialize()`
and `__unserialize()` will throw a deprecation warning.


See [Phasing out Serializable (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/custom_object_serialization) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the functions, methods, properties, or classes that are referenced from a callback but are not found. Use the options below to customize the inspection: Ignore callback from *_exists and is_callable functions: if selected, the inspection will skip callback references from the 'method_exists', 'function_exists', 'property_exists', 'class_exists' and 'is_callable' functions. Don't report in case of ambiguity: if selected, the inspection will skip the parameters with multiple possible types, for example marked as 'callable|string'.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the functions, methods, properties, or classes that are referenced from a callback but are not found.

Use the options below to customize the inspection:

* **Ignore callback from \*_exists and is_callable functions** : if selected, the inspection will skip callback references from the `method_exists`, `function_exists`, `property_exists`, `class_exists` and `is_callable` functions.
* **Don't report in case of ambiguity** : if selected, the inspection will skip the parameters with multiple possible types, for example marked as `callable|string`.

shortDescription.text: Loop can be converted to 'array_map()' call

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'foreach' loops that can be replaced with 'array_map()' calls.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `foreach` loops that can be replaced with `array_map()` calls.

fullDescription.text: Reports the optional parameters that appear before the required parameters in a function/method declaration. See Default argument values (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the optional parameters that appear before the required parameters in a function/method declaration.


See [Default argument values (php.net)](http://www.php.net/manual/en/functions.arguments.php#functions.arguments.default) for details.

shortDescription.text: 'str*()' calls can be replaced with PHP 8 'str_*()' calls

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'strpos' and 'substr' functions calls that can be replaced with the 'str_*' functions calls (introduced in PHP 8.0). See str_contains (php.net) and str_starts_with and str_ends_with functions (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the `strpos` and `substr` functions calls that can be replaced with the `str_*` functions calls (introduced in PHP 8.0).


See [str_contains (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/str_contains) and [str_starts_with and str_ends_with functions (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/add_str_starts_with_and_ends_with_functions) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports '@throws' tags for exceptions that are not thrown by the function or method. The exception classes added to the Unchecked Exceptions list under Settings | PHP | Analysis are excluded from the inspection scope.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports `@throws` tags for exceptions that are not thrown by the function or method.

The exception classes added to the **Unchecked Exceptions** list under
[Settings \| PHP \| Analysis](settings://reference.webide.settings.project.settings.php?Unchecked%20Exceptions)
are excluded from the inspection scope.

shortDescription.text: Symfony annotation can be replaced with attribute

fullDescription.text: Suggests replacing Symfony annotations with attributes.
fullDescription.markdown: Suggests replacing Symfony annotations with attributes.

fullDescription.text: Reports unnecessary semicolons.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports unnecessary semicolons.

shortDescription.text: 'array_map()' call can be converted to loop

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'array_map()' calls that can be replaced with 'foreach' loops.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `array_map()` calls that can be replaced with `foreach` loops.

fullDescription.text: Reports coding style problems detected by PHP_CodeSniffer. The inspection requires PHP_CodeSniffer to be properly installed and set up in the IDE under Settings | PHP | Quality Tools | PHP_CodeSniffer. To learn more about installing PHP_CodeSniffer, see PHP_CodeSniffer installation (GitHub).
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports coding style problems detected by PHP_CodeSniffer.


The inspection requires PHP_CodeSniffer to be properly installed and set up in the IDE under
[Settings \| PHP \| Quality Tools \| PHP_CodeSniffer](settings://settings.php.quality.tools.php.code.sniffer).


To learn more about installing PHP_CodeSniffer, see [PHP_CodeSniffer installation (GitHub)](https://github.com/squizlabs/PHP_CodeSniffer#installation).

fullDescription.text: Reports the '(string)' casts and 'strval()' calls that are redundant since casting to string is performed implicitly.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `(string)` casts and `strval()` calls that are redundant since casting to string is performed implicitly.

shortDescription.text: 'null' is not compatible with parameter's declared type

fullDescription.text: Reports the variables that are initialised via passing them by reference to a parameter incompatible with 'null'.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the variables that are initialised via passing them by reference to a parameter incompatible with `null`.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'preg_replace()' calls with empty 'replacement'. Such calls can be replaced with '(l|r)trim' calls.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `preg_replace()` calls with empty `replacement`. Such calls can be replaced with `(l|r)trim` calls.

fullDescription.text: Reports PHP closing tag '?>' usages, which are redundant in files containing only PHP code.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports PHP closing tag `?>` usages, which are redundant in files containing only PHP code.

fullDescription.text: Reports unnecessary 'return' and 'continue' statements that can be safely removed.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports unnecessary `return` and `continue` statements that can be safely removed.

fullDescription.text: Reports the '__autoload()' function declarations. Starting from PHP 7.4, declaring '__autoload()' functions is deprecated. Starting from PHP 8.0, declaring '__autoload()' functions is forbidden. See __autoload (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the `__autoload()` function declarations.

* Starting from PHP 7.4, declaring `__autoload()` functions is deprecated.
* Starting from PHP 8.0, declaring `__autoload()` functions is forbidden.


See [__autoload (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.autoload.php) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the expressions that use the same operands, but should rather use different operands (for example, '$var == $var'). These include comparison, logical, null-coalescing, subtraction, and division expressions.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the expressions that use the same operands, but should rather use different operands (for example, `$var == $var`). These include comparison, logical, null-coalescing, subtraction, and division expressions.

fullDescription.text: Reports arithmetic and bitwise expressions with unsupported operands. Starting with PHP 8.0, using the arithmetic and bitwise operators '+', '-', '*', '/', '**', '%', '<<', '>>', '&', '|', '^', '~', '++', '--' when one of the operands is an array, resource, or non-overloaded object will result in a 'TypeError'. The only exception is the 'array + array' merge operation, which remains supported. See PHP's internal test source for the complete list of operations.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports arithmetic and bitwise expressions with unsupported operands.


Starting with PHP 8.0, using the arithmetic and bitwise operators `+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, `**`, `%`, `<<`, `>>`, `&`, `|`, `^`, `~`, `++`, `--`
when one of the operands is an array, resource, or non-overloaded object will result in a `TypeError`. The only exception is the
`array + array` merge operation, which remains supported.


See [PHP's internal test source](https://github.com/php/php-src/blob/master/Zend/tests/operator_unsupported_types.phpt) for the complete list of operations.

fullDescription.text: Reports the conditions that are already covered by earlier conditions and thus have no effect as well as the variables that are always true (or always false) when reached.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the conditions that are already covered by earlier conditions and thus have no effect as well as the variables that are always true (or always false) when reached.

fullDescription.text: Reports the '@var' tags for variables whose type is already inferred from source code.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `@var` tags for variables whose type is already inferred from source code.

shortDescription.text: Method name is not following coding convention

fullDescription.text: Reports the methods' names that are either too short, too long, or do not follow the specified regular expression pattern. Some coding styles have a special naming convention for methods. Use the inspection options to specify minimum/maximum length and the regular expression expected for methods' names. To ignore the names' length, specify 0. To learn more about regular expressions, refer to the Quick Start guide (regular-expressions.info).
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the methods' names that are either too short, too long, or do not follow the specified regular expression pattern. Some coding styles have a special naming convention for methods.


Use the inspection options to specify minimum/maximum length and the regular expression expected for methods' names.
To ignore the names' length, specify **0**.


To learn more about regular expressions, refer to the [Quick Start guide (regular-expressions.info)](https://www.regular-expressions.info/quickstart.html).

fullDescription.text: Reports the boolean expressions that contain the 'true' or 'false' literals and can be simplified.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the boolean expressions that contain the `true` or `false` literals and can be simplified.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `@covers` and `@uses` PHPUnit doc tags that are using `ClassName::<*>`. Such annotations won't be supported in PHPUnit 10 and later.

fullDescription.text: Reports the private methods that are never used.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the private methods that are never used.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the assignments that can be replaced with incrementing (`++`) or decrementing (`--`) operations.

fullDescription.text: Reports the magic methods that are not declared as public or are declared as static.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the magic methods that are not declared as public or are declared as static.

fullDescription.text: Reports the exceptions that are already caught by a preceding exception and the exceptions that are caught twice. The 'catch' clauses must be ordered from more specific to more generic ones. Otherwise, some exceptions may not be caught by the most specific handler. See Exceptions (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the exceptions that are already caught by a preceding exception and the exceptions that are caught twice.


The `catch` clauses must be ordered from more specific to more generic ones. Otherwise, some exceptions may not be caught by the most specific handler.

fullDescription.text: Reports the usages of the 'var' keyword for declaring class properties. According to PSR-12, the 'var' keyword MUST NOT be used to declare a property. See PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org) for details.

According to PSR-12, the `var` keyword MUST NOT be used to declare a property.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports `preg_split()` calls that can be replaced with `explode()`.

Reports array unpacking with string keys in PHP \< 8.1

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the assignment statements, in which both sides are equal. Such assignments have no effect and can be removed.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the fully qualified class names that can be shortened by adding the `use` statement.

fullDescription.markdown:

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the alphabetic ranges or characters in regular expression character classes that only adjust the already existing ranges. Such elements can be merged with the adjusted ranges.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports polymorphic code usages. Such usages are ambiguous and can be potentially inoperable depending on the class instance passed as the argument.

fullDescription.text: Reports the static member access expressions used on traits. Such direct access is deprecated starting from PHP 8.1. Instead, static members should be accessed on the class that uses the trait. See Deprecations for PHP 8.1: Accessing static members on traits (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the functions that have no return type declaration specified.

shortDescription.text: Misordered PHPUnit equality assertion method arguments

fullDescription.text: Reports the calls to PHPUnit equality assertion methods (such as 'assertEquals()', 'assertNotEquals()', 'assertSame()', and so on) that have a non-literal as the expected result argument and a literal as the actual result argument. Such calls will behave fine for assertions that pass, but may produce confusing error reports if their expected and actual arguments differ. See assertEquals for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the calls to PHPUnit equality assertion methods (such as `assertEquals()`, `assertNotEquals()`, `assertSame()`, and so on) that have a non-literal as the expected result argument and a literal as the actual result argument. Such calls will behave fine for assertions that pass, but may produce confusing error reports if their expected and actual arguments differ.

fullDescription.text: Reports the classes, methods, functions, constants, or properties that are not used or not reachable from entry points. It also reports all method implementations/overriders. Some unused members might not be reported in the code editor on the fly. Due to performance reasons, a non-private member is checked only when its name rarely occurs in the project. To see all results, run the inspection in batch mode by using Code | Inspect Code... or Code | Run Inspection by Name....
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the classes, methods, functions, constants, or properties that are not used or not reachable from entry points. It also reports all method implementations/overriders.

Some unused members might not be reported in the code editor on the fly. Due to performance reasons, a non-private member is checked only
when its name rarely occurs in the project.

To see all results, run the inspection in batch mode by using **Code \| Inspect Code...** or **Code \| Run Inspection by
Name...**.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'array_search()' calls that are only used for checking whether an element exists in array, that is, the expressions like 'if (array_search($a, $b) === false) {}'. Such calls can be safely replaced with 'in_array()' calls.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `array_search()` calls that are only used for checking whether an element exists in array, that is, the expressions like `if (array_search($a, $b) === false) {}`. Such calls can be safely replaced with `in_array()` calls.

fullDescription.text: Reports the properties, constants, and methods that are declared without visibility definition. According to PSR-12, visibility MUST be defined on: All properties, All constants if your project's PHP minimum version supports constant visibilities (PHP 7.1 or later), All methods. See PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the properties, constants, and methods that are declared without visibility definition.

According to PSR-12, visibility MUST be defined on:

* All properties,
* All constants if your project's PHP minimum version supports constant visibilities (PHP 7.1 or later),
* All methods.


See [PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org)](https://www.php-fig.org/psr/psr-12/#43-properties-and-constants) for details.

shortDescription.text: Deprecated exception handling via doc tags

fullDescription.text: Reports the Composer packages that are required in composer.json but are not installed.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the Composer packages that are required in *composer.json* but are not installed.

fullDescription.text: Reports the functions with the 'never' return type hint that may return some value. Functions with such a return type are not expected to return any value and must prevent the rest of the script execution by either calling 'die()', 'exit()', and so on, or throwing an exception. See noreturn type (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:

See [noreturn type (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/noreturn_type) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports duplicate 'case' expressions in 'switch' statements. If a 'switch' statement contains multiple duplicate 'case' expressions, only the first one is executed.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports duplicate `case` expressions in `switch` statements.

If a `switch` statement contains multiple duplicate `case` expressions, only the first one is executed.

fullDescription.text: Reports visibility modifiers that are specified in the incorrect order. According to PSR-12, the correct order is as follows: When present, the 'abstract' and 'final' declarations MUST precede the visibility declaration. When present, the 'static' declaration MUST come after the visibility declaration. See PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports visibility modifiers that are specified in the incorrect order.

According to PSR-12, the correct order is as follows:

* When present, the `abstract` and `final` declarations MUST precede the visibility declaration.
* When present, the `static` declaration MUST come after the visibility declaration.


See [PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org)](https://www.php-fig.org/psr/psr-12/#46-abstract-final-and-static) for
details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the intersection type declarations that contain redundant types, for example, an intersection type that contains both the parent class and its subclass. See PHP RFC: Pure intersection types (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `instanceof` expressions whose argument is within the hierarchy of the checked variable. Such expressions will always evaluate to `true`.

fullDescription.markdown:
Reports inappropriate `@inheritDoc` usages:

* On non-class members

fullDescription.markdown: Reports reference to a class constant via child class which gets this constant from the parent class by inheritance and does not override it within its own scope. fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `switch` statements that only contain a single `case` statement. Such `switch` statements can be converted into `if` statements.

fullDescription.markdown:

fullDescription.markdown: Reports `var_export()` and `print_r()` calls without the `return` argument when their results are explicitly used. Such calls most probably are a mistake, because `var_export`/`print_r` always returns `null`/`true` if no `argument` is specified.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'continue' statements that are targeting 'switch' statements. In PHP 7.3 and later, such usages are deprecated and will emit an 'E_WARNING', since they are most likely the result of a programming mistake. In PHP, such 'continue' statements are equivalent to 'break', that is, they end the execution of the current 'switch' structure. In other languages, such 'continue' statements behave as 'continue 2' in PHP, that is, they take the execution to a higher level control structure (for example, the next iteration of an outer loop). See continue (php.net), break (php.net), and switch (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the `continue` statements that are targeting `switch` statements. In PHP 7.3 and later, such usages are deprecated and will emit an `E_WARNING`, since they are most likely the result of a programming mistake.

* In PHP, such `continue` statements are equivalent to `break`, that is, they end the execution of the current `switch` structure.
* In other languages, such `continue` statements behave as `continue 2` in PHP, that is, they take the execution to a higher level control structure (for example, the next iteration of an outer loop).


See [continue (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/control-structures.continue.php), [break (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/control-structures.break.php), and [switch (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/control-structures.switch.php) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the inline comments before arguments in function calls that only contain the name of the parameter and thus serve as hints. In PHP 8.0 and later, named arguments can be used instead. See Named arguments (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the inline comments before arguments in function calls that only contain the name of the parameter and thus serve as hints. In PHP 8.0 and later, named arguments can be used instead.


See [Named arguments (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/match_expression_v2) for details.

shortDescription.text: Comment is parsed as attribute in PHP 8.0

fullDescription.text: Reports line comments starting with '#['. In PHP 8.0 and later, such comments are parsed as attributes. See Attributes (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports line comments starting with `#[`. In PHP 8.0 and later, such comments are parsed as attributes.


See [Attributes (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/attributes_v2) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the methods and functions that are returning arrays with known non-trivial keys. Suggests specifying the shape of the returned array via the '#[ArrayShape]' attribute or an array shape in the PHPDoc comment.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the methods and functions that are returning arrays with known non-trivial keys. Suggests specifying the shape of the returned array via the `#[ArrayShape]` attribute or an array shape in the PHPDoc comment.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'catch' clauses with exceptions that are never thrown from the corresponding 'try' block.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `catch` clauses with exceptions that are never thrown from the corresponding `try` block.

fullDescription.text: Reports unpacked function arguments and array elements whose type is neither 'array' nor 'Traversable'. Starting with PHP 8.0, such usages will result in 'Fatal error'.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports unpacked function arguments and array elements whose type is neither `array` nor `Traversable`.


Starting with PHP 8.0, such usages will result in `Fatal error`.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'use' statements with an unnecessary leading '\'. For namespaced names (fully qualified namespace names containing a namespace separator, such as 'Foo\Bar' as opposed to global names that do not, such as 'FooBar'), the leading backslash is unnecessary and not recommended, as import names must be fully qualified and are not processed relative to the current namespace. See Using namespaces: Aliasing/Importing (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the `use` statements with an unnecessary leading `\`.


For namespaced names (fully qualified namespace names containing a namespace separator, such as `Foo\Bar` as opposed to global names that do not, such as `FooBar`), the leading backslash is unnecessary and not recommended, as import names must be fully qualified and are not processed relative to the current namespace.


See [Using namespaces: Aliasing/Importing (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/language.namespaces.importing.php) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the PHPUnit 'assertTrue()' calls whose arguments are of incompatible types. Since the 'assertTrue()' method relies on strict types comparison with 'true', such assertions will always fail.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the PHPUnit `assertTrue()` calls whose arguments are of incompatible types. Since the `assertTrue()` method relies on strict types comparison with `true`, such assertions will always fail.

fullDescription.text: Reports duplicate operands in binary expressions ('+', '-', '*', '/', '&&', '||', and '.') that are in turn used inside comparison expressions. Such operands do not affect the comparison result and can be safely removed.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports duplicate operands in binary expressions (`+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, `&&`, `||`, and `.`) that are in turn used inside comparison expressions. Such operands do not affect the comparison result and can be safely removed.

fullDescription.text: Reports the references to classes whose declarations are not found in the project files, configured include paths, or among the PHP predefined classes. Use the options below to customize the inspection: Ignore PHPDoc: if selected, the inspection will not report the undefined classes referenced in PHPDoc blocks.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the references to classes whose declarations are not found in the project files, configured include paths, or among the PHP predefined classes.

Use the options below to customize the inspection:

* **Ignore PHPDoc**: if selected, the inspection will not report the undefined classes referenced in PHPDoc blocks.

fullDescription.text: Reports nested 'min'/'max' calls. Since the 'min'/'max' functions accept any number of arguments, such nested calls are redundant.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports nested `min`/`max` calls. Since the `min`/`max` functions accept any number of arguments, such nested calls are redundant.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'mixed[]' usages in PHPDoc blocks that can be safely replaced with 'array'.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `mixed[]` usages in PHPDoc blocks that can be safely replaced with `array`.

shortDescription.text: Compound namespace depth is more than 2

fullDescription.text: Reports the usages of compound namespaces whose depth exceeds two levels. According to PSR-12, compound namespaces with a depth of more than two MUST NOT be used. See PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the usages of compound namespaces whose depth exceeds two levels.

According to PSR-12, compound namespaces with a depth of more than two MUST NOT be used.


See [PSR-12: Extended Coding Style (php-fig.org)](https://www.php-fig.org/psr/psr-12/#3-declare-statements-namespace-and-import-statements) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports arguments without name identifiers.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports arguments without name identifiers.

fullDescription.text: Reports duplicate characters provided in the 'characters' argument of functions like 'ltrim' or 'str_words_counts'. Such duplicates are most probably a mistake and can be safely removed.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports duplicate characters provided in the `characters` argument of functions like `ltrim` or `str_words_counts`. Such duplicates are most probably a mistake and can be safely removed.

fullDescription.text: Reports the references to constants that are not found in the project files, configured include paths, or among the PHP predefined constants.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the references to constants that are not found in the project files, configured include paths, or among the PHP predefined constants.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'match' expressions that don't cover all 'enum' cases in 'match' arm conditions.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `match` expressions that don't cover all `enum` cases in `match` arm conditions.

shortDescription.text: Case mismatch in method call or class usage

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the usages of functions, methods, classes, and namespaces that do not match the case used in their declarations.

shortDescription.text: Class static member accessed via instance

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'i' (case insensitivity) modifiers that are used in regular expression patterns containing no letters. Such modifiers are redundant and can be safely removed.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `i` (case insensitivity) modifiers that are used in regular expression patterns containing no letters. Such modifiers are redundant and can be safely removed.

shortDescription.text: Attribute can be added to overriding member

fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the methods' and parameters' attributes that can be propagated to overriding methods/parameters.

fullDescription.text: Reports PHPDoc comments or their parts that contain the information already provided in declarations.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports PHPDoc comments or their parts that contain the information already provided in declarations.

fullDescription.text: Reports the private properties that are never used.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the private properties that are never used.

fullDescription.text: Reports the control structures (such as loops or conditionals) whose bodies are enclosed in braces but only contain a single child statement. Using braces in such cases is not necessary. See Control structures (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the control structures (such as loops or conditionals) whose bodies are enclosed in braces but only contain a single child statement. Using braces in such cases is not necessary.


See [Control structures (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/language.control-structures.php) for details.

shortDescription.text: Method does not override the method from its superclass

fullDescription.text: Checks that the overridden method exists. See PHP RFC: Marking overridden methods (wiki.php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Checks that the overridden method exists.


See [PHP RFC: Marking overridden methods (wiki.php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/marking_overriden_methods) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the '(bool)'/'(boolean)' casts and 'boolval()' calls that are redundant since casting to 'bool' is performed implicitly.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `(bool)`/`(boolean)` casts and `boolval()` calls that are redundant since casting to `bool` is performed implicitly.

fullDescription.text: Reports the 'else' branches in 'if' statements whose bodies always execute a terminating statement such as 'return' or 'throw'. Such branches are redundant and can be safely omitted.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `else` branches in `if` statements whose bodies always execute a terminating statement such as `return` or `throw`. Such branches are redundant and can be safely omitted.

fullDescription.text: Reports the conditions in 'match' expressions that will never be matched. Similarly to PHP Engine behavior, the inspection uses strict comparison ('===') to check the types in 'match' conditions against the 'match' argument type, regardless of the 'strict_types' directive. Since no type coercion occurs, some conditions may be non-matched due to non-matching types. See Match expression (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the conditions in `match` expressions that will never be matched.


Similarly to PHP Engine behavior, the inspection uses strict comparison (`===`) to check the types in `match` conditions against the `match` argument type, regardless of the `strict_types` directive. Since no type coercion occurs, some conditions may be non-matched due to non-matching types.


See [Match expression (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/match_expression_v2) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports duplicate package entries in the 'require' and 'require-dev' sections of composer.json.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports duplicate package entries in the `require` and `require-dev` sections of *composer.json*.

fullDescription.text: Reports the expressions that are calculated, but the calculation result is not used anywhere. Such errors can be caused, for example, by misspelling the '=' operator as '=='.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the expressions that are calculated, but the calculation result is not used anywhere.

Such errors can be caused, for example, by misspelling the `=` operator as `==`.

fullDescription.text: Reports the usages of the entities that are marked as '@internal' and are located in different source roots. The usages located in the same source root are not reported. In most cases, the reported usages should be removed or replaced with other constructs.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the usages of the entities that are marked as `@internal` and are located in different source roots. The usages located in the same source root are not reported.


In most cases, the reported usages should be removed or replaced with other constructs.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports not installed module and suggests to run "importmap:require" or "importmap:install" command

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the boolean expressions inside `if` conditions that contain `$expr == true` or `$expr == false`. Such expressions can be simplified to `if($expr)` and `if(!expr)`.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports named argument with order that does not match parameter order

fullDescription.text: Reports the binary expression operands that do not change the expression result (such as '+ 0' or '. ""') and are therefore redundant.
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the binary expression operands that do not change the expression result (such as `+ 0` or `. ""`) and are therefore redundant.

fullDescription.text: Reports the string concatenation expressions that are used together with '+', '-', '<<', and '>>' operators. Starting with PHP 8, the concatenation operation has lower precedence and such expressions can thus produce unexpected results. See Concatenation precedence (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the string concatenation expressions that are used together with `+`, `-`, `<<`, and `>>` operators. Starting with PHP 8, the concatenation operation has lower precedence and such expressions can thus produce unexpected results.


See [Concatenation precedence (php.net)](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/concatenation_precedence) for details.

fullDescription.text: Reports the attempts to convert the objects having no '__toString' method implementation to 'string'. Prior to PHP 7.4, this would lead to a fatal 'E_RECOVERABLE_ERROR' level error. In PHP 7.4, a fatal non-recoverable 'ERROR' is thrown. In PHP 8.0, the return value follows the standard PHP type semantics and will be coerced into a string if possible and if strict typing is disabled. If the Check __toString exists for each expression type option is enabled, the inspection will check all possible types of the expression and report if at least one of them doesn't contain the '__toString' method implementation. See __toString (php.net) for details.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the attempts to convert the objects having no `__toString` method implementation to `string`.


Prior to PHP 7.4, this would lead to a fatal `E_RECOVERABLE_ERROR` level error. In PHP 7.4, a fatal non-recoverable `ERROR` is thrown. In PHP 8.0, the return value follows the standard PHP type semantics and will be coerced into a string if possible and if strict typing is disabled.


If the **Check __toString exists for each expression type** option is enabled, the inspection will check all possible types of the expression and
report if at least one of them doesn't contain the `__toString` method implementation.


See [__toString (php.net)](https://www.php.net/manual/en/language.oop5.magic.php#language.oop5.magic.tostring) for details.

shortDescription.text: Array access can be replaced with 'foreach' value

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the array access expressions inside `foreach` loops that can be replaced with a `foreach` value.

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the `assertTrue()`/`assertFalse()` calls with the `false`/`true` arguments in PHPUnit tests. Such usages can be replaced with `fail()` calls to indicate that a test is expected to fail.

fullDescription.text: Reports the methods and classes that are incorrectly mocked in PHPUnit tests. The following entities are reported: Enums and 'final' classes 'private', 'static', or 'final' methods Duplicate methods provided in the mocked methods lists via 'addMethods()', 'onlyMethods()', 'setMethods()', and so on.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the methods and classes that are incorrectly mocked in PHPUnit tests.


The following entities are reported:

* `private`, `static`, or `final` methods
* Duplicate methods provided in the mocked methods lists via `addMethods()`, `onlyMethods()`, `setMethods()`, and so on.

fullDescription.text: Reports the variables that are considered unused in the following cases: The value of the variable is not used anywhere or is overwritten immediately. The reference stored in the variable is not used anywhere or is overwritten immediately.
fullDescription.markdown:

* The value of the variable is not used anywhere or is overwritten immediately.
* The reference stored in the variable is not used anywhere or is overwritten immediately.

shortDescription.text: Assignment can be replaced with operator assignment

fullDescription.text: Reports the assignments that can be replaced with combined operator assignments (for example, '+=').
fullDescription.markdown: Reports the assignments that can be replaced with combined operator assignments (for example, `+=`).

fullDescription.text: Reports the class alias declarations that are ignored by the IDE because the actual class declaration with the same FQN exists. The inspection is intended to clarify the IDE’s behavior in the cases when both the class and the class alias declarations are present. When several declarations with the same FQN exist, the IDE usually fails to choose a single one between them. This leads to incorrect code completion, erroneous type inference, and so on. Since the class declaration prevails over the class alias declaration, the latter becomes redundant and therefore ignored by the IDE. Note that ignoring class alias declarations does not affect the behavior of the PHP interpreter.
fullDescription.markdown:
Reports the class alias declarations that are ignored by the IDE because the actual class declaration with the same FQN exists.


The inspection is intended to clarify the IDE's behavior in the cases when both the class and the class alias declarations are present.
When several declarations with the same FQN exist, the IDE usually fails to choose a single one between them.
This leads to incorrect code completion, erroneous type inference, and so on. Since the class declaration prevails
over the class alias declaration, the latter becomes redundant and therefore ignored by the IDE.


Note that ignoring class alias declarations does not affect the behavior of the PHP interpreter.

fullDescription.markdown:

fullDescription.text: Reports invalid string offset usages that will result in a runtime error. The following usages are reported: Using string offsets as objects or arrays Unsetting string offsets via 'unset' Passing string offsets by reference Creating references to or from string offsets Incrementing or decrementing string offsets Using combined operator assignments such as '+=' or '.=' on string offsets Assigning string offsets with empty strings or strings with length >1
fullDescription.markdown:

fullDescription.markdown: Reports the references to functions/methods in the `@dataProvider` PHPDoc tag that are resolved to non-static or non-public methods. Usage of these methods as PHPUnit data providers is deprecated starting from PHPUnit 10.
